Transcript:
Katie: You don't understand. Henry. I already took time off too. I should've 
said no and ruined all my plans?
Henry: Plans? Your plans to go to Australia to find Simon?

Katie: Yes. And know that I know I'll have a job when I get back, I can leave 
anytime.
Henry: That's -- that's great. That's -- that's wonderful.
Katie: What's the matter?

Henry:-- I know why you're going out to find Simon. You love him, okay? That 
makes sense. But what does Kasnoff have to do with this, huh? Why does a man go 
chasing halfway around the world to help a woman find her husband?
Katie: That's easy, Henry. It's because he no, it's because --

Lily: Luke! Honey! Honey, please stop running! Please! Take it easy, just- hey, 
get in the shallow end. Be -be very careful. Come on. Good, now swim. Good! 
You're doing great!
Mike: Did anyone ever tell you you would be a good lifeguard?
Lily: Mike. Hi
Mike: You, Oh.
Lily: Oh, it's so good to see you. It's been weeks.
Mike: Yeah it's been a busy summer.
Lily: Yeah, no kidding.
Mike: Everything okay with you?
Lily: Yes. For the moment. I haven't seen you around here.
Mike: Yeah, well, it's not exactly coincidence. Kind of tracked you down
Lily: Really? Why? What's going on?

Marshall : You always seem to surprise me, Jessica. I never thought I'd see you 
at my door again.

Jessica: The only reason I came over here is because you wouldn't return my 
phone calls.

Marshall : I got in very late last night and didn't get your messages until 
then. Please, come in.

Jessica: Leave it open. I want to know what my daughter was doing in your room 
last night.
Marshall : Bonnie tell you she was here?
Jessica: Are you denying it?
Marshall : No.

Jessica: Well, then you want to tell me what is going on? One minute you're 
wanting me to keep Bonnie away from you, and the next you're entertaining her 
behind closed door

Marshall: Bonnie came here tonight, she said she was here to ask me to take it 
easy on you in court because you're still so fragile you might fall apart at any 
time.
Jessica: She said that?

Marshall : Yeah, she could barely get the words out, it was very emotional for

Jessica: Why would she do that? Why would Bonnie come over here and ask you, of 
all people, for anything?

Bonnie: Walker ? Hi, it's Bonnie. I was wondering if Marshall 's toothbrush is 
gonna work for the DNA test. Okay, can you call me back when you find out? Okay, 
thanks. Bye.
[She gasps] Whoa, hi
Isaac: Hey.
Bonnie: You scared me.
Isaac: Sorry about that. Who was that on the phone?
Bonnie: Dr. Daniels. I was just checking on Sarah's test results.
Isaac: Hmm. How is she? Any more fevers?

Bonnie: Uh -- not lately, but they'll be back. I mean that's the thing with this 
condition of hers, they come and go without any warning.
Isaac: That might be. You let me know if there's anything I can do to help.
[Monitor beeping]

Kim: Are you still with me, my love? Oh, sweetie! You heard me! I know you heard 
me. I love you so much.
Alison: Chris, wait. How's your dad?
Chris: Uh, no change. Mom's in there. She's been here all night.

Allison: That's so sweet. I mean, she's been married to him forever, and she 
still loves him so much.
Chris: They're a great couple. You don't see that every day.
Allison: Tell me about it.
Chris: Everything okay at your house?

Alison: Oh, sure. My mother married a complete lunatic, and we're just one big, 
happy family. I shouldn't put him down, Chris, but -- my mom loves him so much, 
and I know that should be enough, but it isn't. I've got to get out of their 
home.
Rick: Good morning.
Susan: Oh. Morning

Rick: Now, how about I cook us a vegetable omelet the size of a pizza, hmm? I 
don't know about you, I'm starved.
Susan: Rick, you should be in bed.
Rick: Only if you join me.
Susan: We can't ignore this, not after what happened last night.

Rick: No, I'm not ignoring anything. As a matter of fact, I think I figured out 
the --

Susan: Sweetie, you were screaming. We were about to get married, and you 
started screaming, "Stop it, stop it," to I don't know who. I don't know who you 
were talking to. And -- and then you pass out on the floor. You were running a 
fever. Something could be seriously wrong.
[Rick remembering] Rick: Shut up! Shut up! Shut up!
Susan: Please. Please? Get a full workup today.
Emily: Hal, I need to talk to you.
Hal: Good morning to you, too.

Emily: I've been checking up on Jeffrey Starr. The writer -- the medical writer 
who wants to talk to Rick? Only he's not a medical writer. He writes about 
murder.
Hal: You sure it's the same Jeffrey Starr?

Marshall : Bonnie went to the bathroom to supposedly pull herself together. 
Then, after she left, I realized my toothbrush was gone.
Jessica: Well, is it possible the maid threw it away?

Marshall : Well, I've got maids in here twice a day. Anything's possible. But 
when I asked her about it, she looked as guilty as it gets.
Jessica: Why would Bonnie want your toothbrush?
Marshall : I thought you might have heard.
Jessica: I have no idea
Marshall : Well, would you at least ask her about it?
Jessica: I could. Or I could just give you couple of bucks to buy a new one.
Marshall : Forget about it, ok?

Jessica: Yeah, already have. Don't worry, I'll make sure Bonnie doesn't bother 
you again.
Isaac: I've got something to say to you, Bonnie. It's about time.
Bonnie: About time for what?

Isaac: For you to start asking me to help you with Sarah. I realize that I'm a 
little bit hardheaded when you all were first getting to know each other. But 
that's in the past, so what can I do to help?

Bonnie: Well, convince Troy to let me spend an entire day with Sarah, so -- I 
want to go on a picnic, just me, you and Sarah.
Isaac: That sounds good, when do you have in mind?
Bonnie: Mhmm. Tomorrow.
Isaac: Tomorrow's kind of a bad day. You know I have those meetings.
Bonnie: Well, can't you reschedule?

Isaac: Well, of Tom's with Dave, the wine distributor, I can't blow him off 
again.
Bonnie: But, hey, this would be such a great opportunity for you and Sarah to
just really get to know each other.
Isaac: There's no way that you can do it another day?
Bonnie: I doubt it.

Isaac: I'm sorry, Bonnie, but I'm gonna have to say no you're gonna have to 
handle it on your own.

Bonnie: Wait, come on, baby it's -- it's one thing. It's not like it's gonna 
kill your reputation I mean, what would happen if you'd call -

Isaac: Look, I gave you the reasons, good reasons. Why can't we just leave it at 
that?

Bonnie: Because Sarah is much more important than some wine distributor. And she 
needs to be around responsible males. That way, she won't have problems with 
relationships then when she , you know?
Chris: Look, I know Rick was a little out of it at the wedding.
Alison: A little?

Chris: A lot. And it's your home. Okay? You can't let this guy make you feel 
like you gotta pack up and leave.

Alison: Oh, stop right there. I'm not gonna let you or anyone else do this to me 
again.
Chris: What, do what?
Alison: Me. My problem cannot be Rick's.

Chris: Look, I know Rick has problems, okay? To tell you the truth, I'm 
beginning to worry about him myself.
Allison: Thank you.

Chris: I mean, the way he's been acting, I don't want him in charge of my 
father's treatment. But it's different for you, Allison. Okay? He's part of your 
family now. You can't just fire him. All right? Maybe you ought to try and find 
some way to get along with him.

Alison: Well, that would be one way to handle it. But I think I have a better 
one.
Chris: What's that?
Emily: Take a look at these -- Starr's latest work.

Hal: Mother buries children alive. "The hit man priest. The sniper next door. 
These are really nice. Where did you get these?

Emily: I downloaded them off the internet. Starr is a tabloid writer. He doesn't 
write for "The New England Journal of Medicine.
Hal: Did he say he did.
Emily: I don't know, why did he want to talk to Rick about research.
Hal: Maybe I could call on these papers, about his assignment.

Emily: No no, no. Starr doesn't work that way. He generates his own stories, 
then sells them to the highest bidder.
Hal: All right, then I'll talk to the man myself.
Emily: Well, figured you'd say that. The only problem is, I can't find him.
Hal: Did you check the Lakeview? It's the best-known hotel in town.
Emily: Yeah, of course I did. There, few other places. No one's heard of him.

Hal: Well, if he's up to no good, chances are he'd wanna be off the beaten path. 
Maybe some dive on the outskirts of town.
Emily: Can you have someone check on it?
Hal: I'll get on it right away.
Emily: Great.

Susan: I would love anything more than to concentrate on our future. But I'm 
your wife. I've gotta take care of you.

Rick: You know, I love you for saying that, but I'm not in a life-threatening 
situation. I had some kind of a migraine syndrome.
Susan: Migraine? You never said anything about being in pain.

Rick: Well, there's -- that's only just part of it. I mean, there's even 
hallucinations. But it's transitory, and in my case, I think the trigger was 
just excess stress.
Susan: Have you ever had migraines before?
Rick: No, but it's -- all that is not unusual. You know that.
Susan: I also know that incidents like that can be heart-related.
Rick: Oh, no, this was -- this was a one time incident due to unusual pressure.
Susan: Honey, I know you had a hard day.
Rick: A hard day?
Susan: But --

Rick: A hard day? I ran my car off the road, changed two tires in the blazing 
sun, raced over here to get married, knowing full well that you were probably 
worried sick, and I couldn't even call you to explain I overheated, Susan but 
that was -- that was yesterday. I just don't -- don't want to dwell on it.
Susan: I know but -- I need you to see Ben or Chris about having an MRI.
Rick: I don't need one. Now how am I going to convince you of that?
Susan: By giving me test results that say you're okay.
Mike: Katie's going to look for Simon. I'm going with her but I
Lily: Wait, wait, wait go back Katie. You going with her?
Mike: It's a long story just it's something she feels she needs to do.
Lily: How long are you gonna be gone?
Mike: I don know.
Lily: Where are you going?
Mike: Australia to start. After that, who knows?
Lily: What about your job? What are you gonna do?

Mike: The hard part's done. I've given myself out a couple weeks, and my foreman 
can handle the rest.
Lily: I hope Katie appreciates this commitment that you have to her.

Mike: She just -- she's been stuck in this limbo. You know? Ever since Simon

Lily: And that's why you want to know about Simon so Katie can get on with her

Mike: Yes.
Lily: Okay

Mike: If she finds this guy, she's gonna want to stay with him. But I don't feel

Lily: I'll tell you everything you want to know about Simon. But first, you have 
to answer me a question.
Mike: What's that?
Katie: You know, Henry, sometimes I wonder why I stay friends with you.
Henry: Oh, only sometimes? Well, now, I consider that a major victory.

Katie: Why do you have to be so cynical all the time? Mike's not getting 
anything out of helping me. He's just helping me. He's a friend.

Henry: Fine Katie I'm not saying that he's a bad guy. I'm just saying, what's

Katie: You mean after I break his neck for running out on me?
Henry: Right well, that goes with saying.

Katie: Well -- I'll put my arms around him and never let him out of my sight

Henry: Right. So then Mike turns around, and he goes back home with nothing to

Katie: He'll know that I'm happy.
Henry: Well, that's sweet. That'll work on Mother Teresa, but not for his boxers

Katie: You think that Mike's thinking of me in a more-than friendly way, don't

Henry: Well, I know, you're not bad looking, for a woman that's perfect in every

Katie: That's not it. That's not Henry! Mike is -- has no desire to be in a love 
relationship right now
[Henry scoffs]
Henry: Since when?
Katie: He broke up with Molly, that relationship was tough.
Henry: A second, are you sure about that?
Katie: Yes, I'm sure.

Henry: Then, I may be wrong on this, but Mike might not be the friend that you 
think he is.

Chris: I don't know what color the sky is in your world Allison, but I'm not 
moving in with you.

Alison: No, I didn't mean to live with me like we'd be living together. I just

Chris: Call it whatever you want, it's not gonna happen.

Chris: Hey, I'm sorry. All right? If you don't want to stay at your mom's place,

Allison: My Mom will know it's because of Rick, and she really loves him. I

Nurse: Supervisor wants to know where you are again.
Alison: Better go. See you later?
Chris: Can't wait. Hey, Mom.
Kim: Hi, darling.
Chris: How's he doing?

Kim: Come here. I haven't told you about this. Walker Daniels told me that we

Kim: Yeah.
Chris: When?

Kim: Yesterday. Said that his contract here with the hospital is terminated. He

Chris: Know what?
Kim: Well, he thinks that there' s a good chance that Rick is the serial killer.
Chris: What about Gordo?

Kim: Well, he wasn't that specific. I mean, it was kind of vague. But I don't

Chris: Mom, neither will I. If that's the case, I don't want Rick anywhere near

Kim: Sound like you have reasons of your own.
Chris: He's a stranger, okay? There are just too many unanswered questions.

Kim: I know, I know. That's the trouble - nobody has any proof that Rick has 
done wrong. And you know something? If we take him off this case again, we're 
gonna be undermining his career.
Chris: And if he turns out to be innocent --
Kim: Exactly.
Rick: I'm sorry, Susan.
Susan: Don't.
Rick: I didn't mean to snap at you.

Susan: We've been married all of ten hours. And you're already suggesting that 
we just call it quits?
Rick: That's, that's not what I want.

Susan: But that's what you said. And you were angry when you said it. We've

Rick: I know.
Susan: I guess you go right for the knockout

Rick: No. You were pressuring me for an explanation. Fortunately, with good 
reason, Susan, look-- I just can't bear the thought at the way you feel 
something must be wrong with me --not when I have everything that I've ever 
wanted.
Susan: Sweetie, if I was pressuring you, it's only because I love you.
Rick: I know. All right, look, I'll schedule a workup as soon as I can.
Susan: MRI, too.

Rick: Yes an MRI. I'll even bring readout so you and I can read it in bed over

Susan: Let's never have a fight like that again.
Rick: I don't ever want to hurt you, Susan. You have to believe that.
Susan: I -- I
Rick: Anyway, don't you have an early appointment today?
Susan: Oh I do actually, I've got to run. Are you sure you're gonna be okay?

Rick: Yeah, I'm gonna be fine. I just have a few errands to run, and then I'm

Susan: Forget about the errands. They can wait.

Rick: Well -- I guess they can. You know what? I think I'm just gonna hang here

Susan: Now that's what I call a good use of your time. I'll call you later.
Rick: Yeah.
Susan: I love you.

Alison: I can't stay with you mom, then I'll just have to find someplace else to

Decker the demented.
[Sniffing]

Bonnie: I do. I do, and we can do this whole picnic thing some other day.

Isaac: I should start getting prepared for my meetings.
Bonnie: Mom, what's the matter? You look a little --
Jessica: Where is it?

Jessica: Because you went to his room last night, when you said that you would

Bonnie: Well, I was worried about you, Mom. Had to do -- wanted to do something

Jessica: What you wanted was to get something from Marshall to use for a DNA

Bonnie: It's a toothbrush, Mom. He'll probably forget all about it.

Jessica: Or he might decide to ask the maid if she threw it away. And when he

Bonnie: Well, if that happens, Mom, I'll handle it.

Mike: You know what gets me is that people are always complaining about how 
everyone looks out for themselves. And when they see someone helping a friend, 
never believe it's for real.
Lily: Mike, that's why you're going to Australia . For a friend?
Mike: Yes.

Lily: You're not hoping this thing with Katie might turn into more than a 
friendship? Just a little bit?

Mike: Well -- when I -- when I thought that Carly's baby was mine, and it 
wasn't, I just - nothing mattered anymore you know? I was all over the place. I 
didn't know what I was gonna do next. Katie helped me rough that. Ok? It's 
something I can do for her.
Lily: Don't think you answered my question
Mike: l --
Lily: Mm-hmm. Come on.
Mike: I like Katie.
Lily: Ah.

Mike: Okay? I enjoy being around her, but I'm not looking for romance. I haven't 
done real well in that department, so I'm probably gonna stay away from that for 
little while.

Lily: Okay. I'll tell you about Simon Frasier. He loves Katie. He does. There's 
no -- there's no doubt about that.
Mike: Good. Can he be trusted?

Henry: There are two reasons why a man would traipse all the way to Australia to 
help a woman find her husband, ok one would be because he's in love, which you 
insist is not the case. Now, the other for money, which is a lot more liable.

Katie: You're not making any sense, Henry. How would Mike make money out of

Henry: Because Simon is still a fugitive all right? Now, Mike might get some 
money from the government for turning him in.

Katie: Oh, come on Mike is a stand up guy. He would never double-cross me like

Henry: You're right, Katie. He owns one pair of jeans. What more could a person

Katie: Henry, I'm being serious. You're way off base here.

Henry: All right, fine, fine, fine maybe it's not about the money. All right? 
Maybe not. But you have no guarantees that Mike is not gonna blow the whistle on 
Simon.

Katie: I don't need one. That's the farthest thing from his mind. I can

Henry: Have you discussed it with him?
Katie: No, why would I?

Hal: Okay, we're checking every hotel in town. Jeffrey Starr is in Oakdale,

Emily: There were serial murderers at the hospital in San Francisco where Rick 
used to work, right? Hal? Anyway, well Jeffrey investigates murders, then how 
long into the San Francisco case, and found evidence against Rick.
Hal: Those are speculations, Emily. Nothing more.

Emily: Yeah, maybe. Maybe not, Hal. But my mother and sister are living with a

Cop: Lieutenant? I've got the rest of that search.
Emily: What?

Hal: Jeffrey Starr checked in a place called the Wagon Wheel Motel yesterday

Emily: Well, gotta go there. Find out what he knows.
Hal: This is police work, Emily. That means stay here.
Emily: I can help you out. I know what he looks like. Let's go. Come on. Go!

Katie: You need to get out more, Henry what passes for your mind is starting to 
play tricks on you.

Henry: Zero to ten, Katie. What are the chances that Mike is doing this for a 
payday?
Katie: Zero. He could goof off and be in the circus.

Henry: Well, then break out the clown make-up, sweetheart, because I have a 
feeling -- wait a second, wait a second, wait a second. There could be another 
-- there could be another possibility here.
Katie: Thank you, Henry. I was starting to give up

Henry: Now, Mike knows that Simon broke your heart so maybe he wants to get 
Simon put away so that he'd never hurt you again.
Katie: I just gave up on you.

Henry: No, Katie, listen look, honey, I just don't want you to go into this with 
your eyes closed.
Katie: I'm not. Eyes are wide open. That's the only way I'm gonna find Simon.

Henry: But you're not thinking this through. Unless you're absolutely sure about 
what Mike will do when you find Simon, you are running the risk that Simon will 
spend the rest of his behind bars is that the risk you want to take, sweetheart? 
I really don't think it is.
Mike: I thought you were leaving..

Henry: Actually I was leaving. I'm late for an appointment with Mastrolog. Don't 
take any chances okay? You'll never forgive yourself if Simon spends the rest of 
his life in prison, okay? Ah, let's see here, Mr. Kasnoff. I am thinking that 
you're a Leo with a Capricorn rising. Yes, I have a sixth sense about this sort 
thing.
Mike: Let me guess -- Henry said something to upset you.
Katie: Pretty good.
Mike: Anything I can do to help?
Kim: We don't know that Rick's a reputable physician.
Chris: Who's been suspected of murder.
Kim: Well he wasn't convicted.
Chris: Right.

Kim: On the other hand, we know that your father called out his name the last 
time he was conscious.
Chris: We don't know why so that doesn't really help.
Kim: I guess not.

Chris: Walker Daniels thinks that Rick is the killer. I mean, that has to mean 
something.
Kim: Yes.

Chris: Don't know whether to ask Rick out to lunch or to try get him put away 
for 20 years.
Nurse: Sorry, but I have to examine Dr. Hughes.
Chris: I got to go finish running some, will you be here?
Chris: Oh, hey. I thought you had people looking for you?

Alison: Well, if there's one thing I've learned about this job, it's that 
there's always another bedpan. But besides that, I have a really good idea about 
another place to stay.
Chris: What's that?
Allison: At your parents'!

Chris: Allison, come on. My mom's not in any condition to be running a bed and

Allison: Can't you ask? That's exactly why I should be there.

Allison: Well, your mother's all tied up with your dad. So, I can cleanup 
everything. Can do laundry, make beds. Anything. Anything your mom needs help 
with. I mean this is a perfect win-win situation. So, can you talk to your mom, 
please?
Chris: Me? Why me?

Alison: Because you know her better. Because that'll give me a better chance. 
Please?
Chris: Okay, Allison. I'll talk to her, but I' m not gonna make any promises.
Hal: All right listen. Starr's room, I want you to stay back.
Emily: Why? You gonna kick it in?
Hal: Would you like me to?
Emily: Oh, yeah. Very much.

Hal: Well, I wish you'd told me sooner. I would've worn my kicking-in-the-door 
shoes.
Emily: So what are you saying, Munson, you're not gonna do...
Hal: First, I think I'll ask the manager for a key.
Emily: And you call yourself a cop. Hang on, hang on. I'm really afraid, Hal.
[Sniffing]

Jessica: Bonnie, you know what that man did to me. He is unscrupulous, and he 
knows what to use. Do you have any idea what risk you took by going to his room 
alone?
Bonnie: He's not gonna have me arrested for stealing a toothbrush.

Jessica: Okay. What about for conducting a DNA test without his knowledge or

got off last time with community service. If you get caught breaking the law 
again, Bonnie, you could go to jail.
Bonnie: Okay. Okay, I'm sorry. I should've never gone to Marshall's room.
Jessica: Action speaks louder than words, honey.
Bonnie: I will never go near him again. Is that good enough?
Jessica: And what if it turns out that Marshall is Sarah's father?
Bonnie: Same thing. I am not gonna let him near her.

Jessica: No, honey, you see that's the point. You can't do that. They both have

Bonnie: Marshall is despicable Mom, I am not gonna let him into her life!

Jessica: Look, Bonnie, I have to go out of town for a few days. I cannot be here

Bonnie: Fine. I'll let it stand. I'm not even sure this whole toothbrush thing

Jessica: Well, then, just drop it. Now. And stay away from Marshall once and for 
all.
Bonnie: Okay. Okay. I hate it when you're mad at me.

Jessica Listen, I've got to get to the office. I really hate starting my day 
like this.
Bonnie: I know.

Katie: Oh, um -- Henry is just starting another scam of his, and, um -- he's 
bound to get in trouble. I'm just sick of it - I'm sure that's what you picked 
up on.

Mike: Whatever. That's his problem. You're not gonna be in town much longer,

Mike: Operation to Australia all set. I have our itinerary right here. You wanna

Katie: No, um -- I don't think that'll be necessary Mike. Actually, I was

Mike: Okay. Like what?

Chris: Okay. I will ask my mother if you can stay with us for a little while.

Allison: You mean Rick could be a normal guy? A little weird but nothing to

Chris: Anything, is possible, Allison. We haven't found any proof that he's done
